question.text: The fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster was found to be very suitable for experimental verification of chromosomal theory of inheritance by Morgan and his colleagues because

options.text: a single mating produces two young flies
smaller female is easily recognisable from larger male
it completes life cycle in about two weeks

solution.text:
The fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster was found to be very suitable for experimental verification of chromosomal theory of inheritance by Morgan and his colleagues because
- it completes its life cycle in a very short period (ie, about two weeks).
- a single mating produces many offsprings.
- larger female is easily recognisable from smaller male.
